children.text: Reference: Panopto Workplace Knowledge and Productivity Report
the premise and pitch of Living Spec in spec format. 🎉 🎉 🎉
A single source of truth for projects and products
Transforming organizations into efficient collaboration machines
for how to best support distributed teams.
Finish foundation to support rapid growth
World leaders in building, managing, leading, and consulting on software products
Increasingly frustrated with the status quo of how companies collaborate and document decisions
Pioneered JavaScript and TypeScript frameworks & remote-first leadership and consulting (SitePen. Dojo)
Expert in efficient software architecture and software collaboration methodologies
Exceptional Enterprise Business Analyst. Ex-Sogeti, Thomson Reuters
Outstanding creator of web and mobile user experiences
Former co-founder, Change Point of Sale
Expert in web app architecture and VR/XR, Ex-Shutterfly, SitePen
Payment (monthly or annual, user type and plan type)
Leverage extensive enterprise and technology network of our team and advisors for early adoption
Integrations with key technologies enterprises already leverage to eliminate onboarding and adoption obstacles
Gently gamified onboarding to encourage use and adoption
Key metrics on time/effort/efficiency saved within each organization and in-aggregate (even better with automations) and flood the market with these insights
In the past, bad tools could be more easily avoided or ignored via in-person meetings
Now everyone is working from home
Tools that were previously “good enough” are now obviously not enough when everyone needs to use them every day, amplifying the problem
Reduces a barrier to market resistance as everyone is looking for more efficient ways to collaborate, even if/when people return to the office
Where is the information I need?
, people’s heads, verbally at meetings, in chat
Teams will save substantial time in communication and tedious tasks, onboarding, and more
The right product gets built faster, substantially saving organizations
Organizers operate and get managed more efficiently with better transparency and institutional memory and knowledge
Living Spec provides a foundation for getting things done and keeping key information current, consistent, and accurate
Tooling and automation that make sense to product teams and don’t feel like the software equivalent of an unhelpful project manager
Less tedious than dozens of form fields, organized hierarchy
Feels fun and easy to use, saving time and effort
Connect key systems and teams together
Collaborate on key details in context rather than fragments
Workflows, tasks, and insights insights with
for a project’s scope, progress, and vision that
agile processes instead of fighting against them
From Confluence to Google Docs to SharePoint, Coda to Notion, Airtable to Taskade, many companies provide productivity solutions.
None feel natural or efficient for providing an efficient single source of truth.

children.fromText: Highly structured task and project managers

children.text: Highly structured task and project managers
Interesting discussions happen in Slack, Teams, Zoom, etc.
Without a super organized manager, these details never end up in the shared spec and history, instead buried in people's heads.
You can easily see what needs to happen by whom
Process is good (or too strict?), but
into separate tasks through a task management tool is tedious and redundant
Examples: Jira, Basecamp, Monday, Linear, Asana, Trello, Taskade, Clubhouse, Evernote, Aha, etc.
sets in with either lack of organization or tedium
Examples: Confluence, Notion, Coda, Slite, CardboardIT, Aha, AirTable, Google Docs, Office, SharePoint, Wikis, etc.
Existing systems are tedious, fail to provide sufficient benefits, don’t align with human nature - so much ⌛ time and 💸 money gets wasted
